answers.author: Raymond Gosack
answers.text:
Fort Smith has 3 citizens academies -- police, fire, and the city in general.  Our general academy is producing a cadre of citizens who gain a deep understanding of how city government operates.  They recognize employees, have become a voice on community issues, and help us engage the public.  We make our academy succeed by keeping it very interactive and hands on.  Citizens see, feel, and do.  In the process, they meet line employees and become very impressed with the employees' passion.

The City of Plano began the Citizens Government Academy last spring and is just finishing the second session. It has proven immensely popular, six sessions, every two weeks let residents  learn about the many and varied services and to meet and interact with city staff and city council, one session features "a day in the life of a resident" and showcases the various way you interact on a daily basis with a variety of city services.  Here is a link  http://plano.gov/Pages/citizensacademy.aspx

author: Jessica Melton
text:
The Citizen Academy is a program that provides an opportunity for citizens to become familiar with the technology, programs, departments, services, and plans in their local government. This seems like an effective and vibrant method to educate the community about their own city.
Does anyone have a citizen academy? Or heard of a great program? Have good advice?
Please email me any brochures or information you may have.
Thank you,
Jess
title: Citizen Academy Engagement
